long: Meaning: properly, to "sit" down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to "dwell", to "remain"; causatively, to "settle", to "marry".  Usage: (make to) abide(-ing), continue, (cause to, make to) dwell(-ing), ease self, endure, establish, × fail, habitation, haunt, (make to) inhabit(-ant), make to keep (house), lurking, × marry(-ing), (bring again to) place, remain, return, seat, set(-tle), (down-) sit(-down, still, -ting down, -ting (place) -uate), stay, take, tarry, wait.  Source: a primitive root;
